title: Israeli Troops Rush Into Gaza Neighbourhood, Order Palestinians To Go South
content: Israel rushed into a neighbourhood in Gaza City on Thursday, ordering Palestinians to move south as the tanks rolled in and bombing the southern city of Rafah in what it says are the final stages of an operation against Hamas militants there.
summary: Israel rushed into a neighbourhood in Gaza City on Thursday, ordering Palestinians to move south as the tanks rolled in and bombing the southern city of Rafah in what it says are the final stages of an operation against Hamas militants there.

title: Space Station Astronauts Forced To Shelter After Russian Satellite Breaks Up
content: A Russian satellite has broken up into more than 100 pieces of debris in orbit, forcing astronauts on the International Space Station to take shelter, US space agencies said.
summary: A Russian satellite has broken up into more than 100 pieces of debris in orbit, forcing astronauts on the International Space Station to take shelter, US space agencies said.

title: Time Magazine Signs Multi-Year Content Deal With ChatGPT Maker OpenAI
content: Time magazine has signed a multi-year content deal with OpenAI that would give the ChatGPT maker access to its archive of news content, the companies said on Thursday.
summary: Time magazine has signed a multi-year content deal with OpenAI that would give the ChatGPT maker access to its archive of news content, the companies said on Thursday.

title: Chinese AI Startups Rush To Offset OpenAI's Plans To Curb API Access
content: ChatGPT is not available in China, but many Chinese startups have been able to access OpenAI's API platform and use it to build their own applications. Now, OpenAI plans to curb that too.
summary: ChatGPT is not available in China, but many Chinese startups have been able to access OpenAI's API platform and use it to build their own applications. Now, OpenAI plans to curb that too.

title: The Best Way To Cool Down Quickly And Safely In A Heatwave
content: As the heatwave begins to grip the UK and the heat health alert is in effect, people are looking for ways to keep cool and reduce the risk of heat stroke  the most severe form of hyperthermia, with a body temperature above 40C.
summary: As the heatwave begins to grip the UK and the heat health alert is in effect, people are looking for ways to keep cool and reduce the risk of heat stroke  the most severe form of hyperthermia, with a body temperature above 40C.

title: ChatGPT Answers Went 'Undetected', Got Better Grades Than Students: Study
content: Exam graders could have trouble spotting answers generated by AI-based chatbots, researchers said after their study found that these answers not only went undetected but were also graded better than those written by students.
summary: Exam graders could have trouble spotting answers generated by AI-based chatbots, researchers said after their study found that these answers not only went undetected but were also graded better than those written by students.

title: Rishi Sunak To Priti Patel: A look At Indian-Origin MPs In UK Parliament
content: With just over a week to go for the all-important July 4 UK polls, all eyes are now on Rishi Sunak and his Conservative Party as they attempt to retain power against a resurgent Labour Party.
summary: With just over a week to go for the all-important July 4 UK polls, all eyes are now on Rishi Sunak and his Conservative Party as they attempt to retain power against a resurgent Labour Party.

title: China's Communist Party Expels 2 Former Ministers Over Corruption: Report
content: China's Communist Party on Thursday expelled former defence minister Li Shangfu and his predecessor Wei Fenghe for "serious violations of discipline", a euphemism for corruption, state news agency Xinhua reported.
summary: China's Communist Party on Thursday expelled former defence minister Li Shangfu and his predecessor Wei Fenghe for "serious violations of discipline", a euphemism for corruption, state news agency Xinhua reported.

title: Over 50% Indians More Confident About Using AI At Work: Boston Report
content: The report, titled "AI at Work: Friend and Foe," by Boston Consulting Group (BCG), indicates that 54 per cent of Indian respondents ranked confidence in their top two sentiments towards AI at work.
summary: The report, titled "AI at Work: Friend and Foe," by Boston Consulting Group (BCG), indicates that 54 per cent of Indian respondents ranked confidence in their top two sentiments towards AI at work.

title: No Court Relief To Imran Khan, Wife In "Un-Islamic" Marriage Case: Report
content: A district and sessions court in Islamabad declined the pleas of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, as well as his wife, Bushra Bibi, to suspend their seven-year sentences in the Iddat Case on Thursday, reported Dawn.
summary: A district and sessions court in Islamabad declined the pleas of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, as well as his wife, Bushra Bibi, to suspend their seven-year sentences in the Iddat Case on Thursday, reported Dawn.

title: IMF Maps 174 Countries' Artificial Intelligence Readiness. India Is At...
content: The International Monetary Fund released an Artificial Intelligence Preparedness Index Dashboard on their website on Tuesday, tracking 174 economies globally for AI readiness.
summary: The International Monetary Fund released an Artificial Intelligence Preparedness Index Dashboard on their website on Tuesday, tracking 174 economies globally for AI readiness.

title: Marilyn Monroe's Home Declared Historic Landmark Debarring Demolition
content: The Los Angeles home where Marilyn Monroe died was declared a historic landmark on Wednesday, thwarting plans by its current owners to demolish the property.
summary: The Los Angeles home where Marilyn Monroe died was declared a historic landmark on Wednesday, thwarting plans by its current owners to demolish the property.

title: N Korea Tests Multiple-Warhead Missile Amid Growing Tensions With S Korea
content: North Korea successfully tested its multiple-warhead missile capability, state media said Thursday, as dozens more trash-laden balloons from Pyongyang landed in the South.
summary: North Korea successfully tested its multiple-warhead missile capability, state media said Thursday, as dozens more trash-laden balloons from Pyongyang landed in the South.

title: NBC Brings AI Version Of Legendary Broadcaster To Olympic Coverage
content: US media giant NBC Universal on Wednesday announced that it will use the AI version of a legendary sports broadcaster to narrate personalized daily recaps of Olympic game events.
summary: US media giant NBC Universal on Wednesday announced that it will use the AI version of a legendary sports broadcaster to narrate personalized daily recaps of Olympic game events.

title: Top Candidate For Interpol Chief Accused Of Kidnapping 2 Indian Businessmen
content: Mubita Nawa faces allegations of kidnapping and extortion linked to a £105M court case involving businessmen Vinod and Uddit Sadhu.
summary: Mubita Nawa faces allegations of kidnapping and extortion linked to a Â£105M court case involving businessmen Vinod and Uddit Sadhu.

title: US Man Executed For Raping, Killing Drug Dealer's Girlfriend In 2001
content: An American man was executed Wednesday in Texas for the 2001 murder of a woman.
summary: An American man was executed Wednesday in Texas for the 2001 murder of a woman.

title: Ahead Of UK Polls, All You Need To Know About British PM Rishi Sunak
content: UK will vote on July 4 in a snap general election called by PM  Rishi Sunak. With his Conservative Party trailing the Labour Party by 21 points in the latest polls, Mr Sunak faces an uphill task to retain his party's 14-year grip on power.
summary: UK will vote on July 4 in a snap general election called by PM  Rishi Sunak. With his Conservative Party trailing the Labour Party by 21 points in the latest polls, Mr Sunak faces an uphill task to retain his party's 14-year grip on power.

title: New Strain Of Mpox Causing Miscarriages, Killing Children, Warn Scientists
content: A new deadlier strain of mpox that transmits more easily between people is killing children and causing miscarriages in the Democratic Republic of Congo and may have already spread to neighbouring countries, researchers have warned.
summary: A new deadlier strain of mpox that transmits more easily between people is killing children and causing miscarriages in the Democratic Republic of Congo and may have already spread to neighbouring countries, researchers have warned.

title: New Zealand Woman Who Sued Ex Boyfriend Over Airport Ride Loses Claim
content: The promise of a ride to the airport is not legally binding, a woman in New Zealand has discovered after seeking compensation from her ex-boyfriend because she missed her flight.
summary: The promise of a ride to the airport is not legally binding, a woman in New Zealand has discovered after seeking compensation from her ex-boyfriend because she missed her flight.

title: Astronaut Sunita Williams' Return To Earth Delayed Again. What NASA Said
content: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams' scheduled return to Earth has been delayed once again after the spacecraft in which she travelled to space, the Boeing Starliner, faced a series of technical glitches.
summary: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams' scheduled return to Earth has been delayed once again after the spacecraft in which she travelled to space, the Boeing Starliner, faced a series of technical glitches.
